description_txt: stated on April 11, 2016 in a TV interview:
quote_txt: The Colorado caucus system for selecting Republican delegates is "rigged."

description_txt: stated on April 17, 2016 in an interview on Fox News Sunday:
quote_txt: "The chairman of the party of Florida, who is an avid and outward supporter of Marco Rubio, gets to appoint 30 of those delegates."

description_txt: stated on April 8, 2016 in a Facebook post:
quote_txt: Says Republican presidential candidate and Gov. John Kasich has spent 177 days out of state and used $350,000 in taxpayer money on his "costly campaign."

description_txt: stated on April 14, 2016 in the Democratic debate in Brooklyn, N.Y.:
quote_txt: "We spend about 75 percent of the entire cost of the military aspect of NATO."

description_txt: stated on April 13, 2016 in a press conference on fire season:
quote_txt: "90 percent of fires in Arizona are human-caused."

description_txt: stated on April 7, 2016 in a website post:
quote_txt: "Tax dodging costs developing countries $200 billion every year."

description_txt: stated on April 12, 2016 in a speech in Syracuse, N.Y.:
quote_txt: "We win when voter turnout is high, we lose when it is low."

description_txt: stated on April 6, 2016 in a candidates forum:
quote_txt: Richmond teachers have not gotten a raise "for almost 10 years."

description_txt: stated on April 12, 2016 in a speech in Rome, N.Y.:
quote_txt: Says Jeb Bush and Marco Rubio "had it set so that the winner takes everything, because they wanted to make sure that I didn't get anything" in the Florida primary.

description_txt: stated on March 17, 2016 in a Republican gubernatorial debate:
quote_txt: "We’re the worst state in the country at moving people from welfare to work."

description_txt: stated on April 14, 2016 in To the media:
quote_txt: "While Mayor Kenney personally doesn't support DROP, he can't fault highly qualified city employees for appropriately utilizing a benefit that's available to them."

description_txt: stated on April 12, 2016 in a radio interview.:
quote_txt: "But for immigrants, we would have a contracting population..."

description_txt: stated on April 17, 2016 in an interview on NBC's "Meet the Press":
quote_txt: "The city of Charlotte passed a bathroom ordinance mandate on every private-sector employer in Charlotte."

description_txt: stated on April 11, 2016 in a speech:
quote_txt: "You’re in more trouble if you leave your pet in the car than if you leave your child in the car."

description_txt: stated on March 10, 2016 in a speech :
quote_txt: Says New Hampshire’s second congressional district includes two counties where "almost 5 percent if not more" of residents are enrolled in the state’s expanded Medicaid program.

name_txt: Our City, Our Safety, Our Choice
description_txt: stated on April 8, 2016 in a fund-raising letter from female supporters:
quote_txt: Austin’s Stop Abuse for Everyone has seen in its offices "sexual assault survivors that report being attacked by their ridesharing drivers, at a rate of one per month."

description_txt: stated on April 10, 2016 in a voter forum hosted by the League of Women Voters of the Austin Area:
quote_txt: Statistics show "you are about nine times more likely to be assaulted by a taxi driver" in Austin than a driver for a ride-hailing service.

description_txt: stated on March 29, 2016 in a forum:
quote_txt: About "1 percent of all the gun sellers are responsible for more than half of the guns that are used in crimes."

description_txt: stated on March 29, 2016 in an interview:
quote_txt: Ten times, no Republican candidate for president had enough delegates to claim the nomination before the party’s convention, and seven of those times "somebody who was not the leader of delegates was selected as the nominee of the party."

description_txt: stated on April 14, 2016 in a Democratic debate in Brooklyn:
quote_txt: In nine Democratic debates, "We've not had one question about a woman's right to make her own decisions about reproductive health care, not one question."

description_txt: stated on April 14, 2016 in the Brooklyn presidential debate:
quote_txt: The Republicans "still want to privatize (Social Security). In fact, their whole idea is to turn over the Social Security trust fund to Wall Street."

description_txt: stated on April 15, 2016 in a Democratic debate in New York:
quote_txt: "When this campaign began, I said that we’ve got to end the starvation minimum wage of $7.25, raise it to $15. Secretary Clinton said let's raise it to $12."

description_txt: stated on April 14, 2016 in the Democratic debate in New York:
quote_txt: Says Bernie Sanders "has been largely a very reliable supporter of the NRA."

description_txt: stated on April 14, 2016 in the Brooklyn presidential debate:
quote_txt: "I remain one of the poorer members of the United States Senate."

description_txt: stated on April 14, 2016 in a Democratic debate in New York:
quote_txt: "We have tougher standards holding toy gun manufacturers and sellers to account than we do for real guns."

description_txt: stated on March 28, 2016 in a Facebook video:
quote_txt: "Every bit of plastic that has ever been created still exists."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • April 14, 2016

description_txt: stated on April 11, 2016 in a rally in Rome, N.Y.:
quote_txt: "My numbers are better right now than Ronald Reagan's numbers were with Jimmy Carter."

description_txt: stated on March 28, 2016 in an interview with Fox Business :
quote_txt: "Senate Bill 1070, simply, just mirrors federal law."

description_txt: stated on April 11, 2016 in a newspaper interview:
quote_txt: "There are 31 other states and 10,000 other cities that have the same type of policies that we just passed," referring to North Carolina’s House Bill 2.

description_txt: stated on April 10, 2016 in in an interview on NBC's Meet the Press:
quote_txt: Says Hillary Clinton supported and continues to "support fracking."
